intro: Plectanthera ciliosa, commonly known as the hairy plectanthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Plectanthera ciliosa is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
